stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

preGame:
üéôÔ∏è STEP RIGHT UP, SPORTS FANS! IT'S A CHAMPIONSHIP-CALIBER TUESDAY NIGHT AT FLETCHINGS FIELD! üéôÔ∏è Well, hello there, Osterra! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live for Game 4 of this pulse-pounding Winners Bracket series! We‚Äôve seen the Oak & Onslaught take a commanding lead, only for those mountain-climbing Tamers to claw back a victory in Game 3. The atmosphere here is thick enough to choke a wyvern, and the stakes? They‚Äôre higher than Sir Randy‚Äôs ego when he‚Äôs looking at his own reflection in that fancy bow of his! üèπüå≤

The local Warden fans are out in full force, and let me tell you, the popularity of Oak & Onslaught is through the roof‚Äîprobably because they‚Äôre the only ones who can navigate this druid-messed shifting terrain without looking like a drunken goblin! I just saw Milt Casady leading the team in a synchronized chant that‚Äôs shaking the very banners of Fletchings Field. Meanwhile, over in the visitors' dugout, Zadoc Wyatan is passing around a ceremonial cup of non-alcoholic grog. Non-alcoholic? In this economy? No wonder the crowd is booing! ü•§üòí

Keep an eye on the rituals, folks! Saloma Talich just got punched in the shoulder by a teammate‚Äînow that's my kind of pre-game warm-up! And look at Dric Trilley over there, reciting her grocery list backward to clear her mind. I hope she didn't forget the 'pain' on that list, because the Wardens are looking to bring a heavy serving of it! Will the Tamers tie the series, or will Oak & Onslaught send them packing to the Losers Bracket? Grab your leather and your lances, because it‚Äôs time for Trollball! üèàüí•
postGame:
### üèüÔ∏è AN OVERTIME THRILLER! OAK & ONSLAUGHT CLINCH THE SERIES! üèüÔ∏è

Well, smack my horns and call me a hero, what a defensive masterclass we just witnessed! This Game 4 was a grind-it-out, tooth-rattling affair that proved once and for all that in the playoffs, every inch of dirt is bought with a pint of blood! The scoreboard might only show a 1-0 final, but the carnage on the field told a much more colorful story! Oak & Onslaught have taken the game and the series 3-1, sending the Oread's Summit Tamers tumbling down the mountain and into the Losers Bracket! üèîÔ∏èüìâ

The match started with a defensive stalemate that would make the Governor-King Zenku hide his face in even more shame! Milt Casady snagged the ball early, but the Tamers' defense was stickier than a spider‚Äôs web in the Demon Prison. We saw tackle after tackle fail, with Wynnie Faina and Hole Bowerman blocking everything the Tamers threw at them. It was a clinic in Warden resilience, folks! üõ°Ô∏èüå≥

Things got truly interesting when Millham Evangeline tried to zip a pass to Normi Glaudia, but the ball hit the dirt! The scramble was on, and Abner Seidel‚Äîsporting those lucky garish undergarments, no doubt‚Äîsnatched it up! But the Tamers weren't going down without a fight. Dric Trilley was hunting for a hit, though she couldn't quite find her mark in the shifting gully of Fletchings Field. ü¶¥üèÉ

Then came the beautiful violence! Milt Casady decided he‚Äôd seen enough of Odericus Juxon and delivered a tackle so crisp it probably rattled the teeth of the gods! Juxon was sent straight to the healer‚Äôs tent with a one-way ticket to 'Ouch-ville.' But don't count the Tamers out for being soft! Saloma Talich got her revenge moments later, absolutely flattening Milt Casady and sending him to join the infirmary party! That‚Äôs the playoff spirit I love! üöëüî•

Hole Bowerman wasn't about to let the Tamers have the last laugh. She lined up Alwyn Wandy and delivered a crunching blow that left Wandy seeing stars instead of goals! By the time we hit the end of regulation, the score was still a goose-egg for both sides, and the tension was thicker than the fog in Zmeigorod. We were heading to Overtime, and the crowd was absolutely losing their minds! üì£üåå

In the extra period, the energy shifted faster than Falric‚Äôs loyalties when there‚Äôs a coin on the ground! Teria Ravo grabbed the ball in Center Field, and you could see the determination in her eyes‚Äîor maybe that was just the lingering effects of headbutting the goalpost earlier! The Tamers' defense tried to hold, but they were gassed, breathing that thick Warden air instead of their thin mountain breeze! üå¨Ô∏èü•ä

Normi Glaudia, still wearing his boots on the wrong feet‚Äîwhich apparently helps with traction in the mud‚Äîtook a shot that missed, but the pressure was relentless. Abner Seidel kept the possession alive, and Millham Evangeline started the final charge. The Tamers were scrambling, but Dric Trilley missed a crucial tackle on Glaudia, and that was the opening the Wardens needed! üö™üí•

Normi Glaudia put his head down and charged like a rhino through a flower shop! He broke through the final line of defense and DUNKED that Trollball into the End Zone for the game-winning touchdown! The stadium erupted! You‚Äôd think Sir Artorias himself had just slain a dragon by the way these fans are screaming! It was a 1-0 victory for the ages, proving that sometimes, one point is all you need to ruin someone's day! üèÜüéØ

I have to say, the Tamers put up a hell of a fight in this series, but today they just couldn't find the basket. Maybe if they spent less time with Kython and his circus freaks and more time hitting the training dummy, they‚Äôd be moving on. Instead, they‚Äôre looking at the Losers Bracket, while Oak & Onslaught is marching forward like an unstoppable forest fire! üî•üå≤

Ahron Latashia is going to have her hands full tonight stitching Milt Casady back together, but I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôll be fine for the next round. These Wardens are as tough as the ancient oaks they protect, and a little thing like an injury won't keep them down for long in the Everwar! üè•‚öîÔ∏è

So, as the sun sets over Fletchings Field and the fans go home to drink enough ale to make Imra jealous, remember this: in Trollball, the mountain might be tall, but the forest is deep, and today the forest won! This is Nok the Corrupter, thanking you for joining me for another brutal Tuesday Night. If you see a Haven Light on your way out, give 'em a nudge for me‚Äîpreferably into a ditch! Goodnight, Osterra! üåôüëø
